MONL.content: surging wave [déferlment déchainé] of anamnesia that the double interdict unleashed > invent one’s language and “I” at the same time [see p. 70 on autobiography]
MONL.linkedContent: surging wave [déferlment déchainé] of anamnesia that the double interdict unleashed > invent one’s language and “I” at the same time [see p. 70 on autobiography]

MONL.content: desire is borne by the arrival itself, before ipseity (I-me)
MONL.linkedContent: desire is borne by the arrival itself, before ipseity (I-me)

LOBL.content: the Il (who says “I”) donne la mort, he, the narrator (I), kills
LOBL.linkedContent: the Il (who says “I”) donne la mort, he, the narrator (I), kills

LOBL.content: arrêt arrests itself, stands, stays unstable, remains on arête of itself, it a-rests (for) itself, no consciousness, perception, no watchfulness can gather this remnance, no “I”, hence ghosts, fantasies, epochal pause
LOBL.linkedContent: arrêt arrests itself, stands, stays unstable, remains on arête of itself, it a-rests (for) itself, no consciousness, perception, no watchfulness can gather this remnance, no “I”, hence ghosts, fantasies, epochal pause

LOBL.content: l’arrêt de mort, “ingenious” decision, one of those that are made (s’arrêtent) only in a language, escape signature by any “I”, untranslatable, decision is unreadable > unreadability does not arrest reading in face of opaque surface, it starts reading, writing, translating again
LOBL.linkedContent: l’arrêt de mort, “ingenious” decision, one of those that are made (s’arrêtent) only in a language, escape signature by any “I”, untranslatable, decision is unreadable > unreadability does not arrest reading in face of opaque surface, it starts reading, writing, translating again

POO.content: use of “I” as an example, am I writing an autobiography? or writing about “I” in general, where I become exemplary
POO.linkedContent: use of “I” as an example, am I writing an autobiography? or writing about “I” in general, where I become exemplary

MPM.content: “I” effaces its singularity as it designates it
MPM.linkedContent: “I” effaces its singularity as it designates it

MPM.content: Paul de Man translates Hegel’s “Ich kann nicht sagen was ich (nur) meine” as ‘I cannot say I’ > effacing of I, a priori functional forgetting > “Autobiography as De-facement”
MPM.linkedContent: Paul de Man translates Hegel’s “Ich kann nicht sagen was ich (nur) meine” as ‘I cannot say I’ > effacing of I, a priori functional forgetting > “Autobiography as De-facement”

MPM.content: memory effaces remembrances—like “I” effaces itself [I forgets I at beginning of sentence]
MPM.linkedContent: memory effaces remembrances—like “I” effaces itself [I forgets I at beginning of sentence]

SEC.content: for Austin, signature is equal to verbal utterance coming from “I”, for signature to maintain itself: pure reproducibility of pure event
SEC.linkedContent: for Austin, signature is equal to verbal utterance coming from “I”, for signature to maintain itself: pure reproducibility of pure event

SEC.content: for Derrida, for a signature to function, to be legible, it must detach itself from present and singular intention of its production; its sameness alters its identity and singularity, divides the seal
SEC.linkedContent: for Derrida, for a signature to function, to be legible, it must detach itself from present and singular intention of its production; its sameness alters its identity and singularity, divides the seal

VM.content: name of philosophical subject, when he says “I”, a pseudonym
VM.linkedContent: name of philosophical subject, when he says “I”, a pseudonym

OH.content: replace “I” w/ “we” > move from feeling to axiom
OH.linkedContent: replace “I” w/ “we” > move from feeling to axiom

VP.content: in phenomenology, transcendental consciousness, the archi-region, is absolutely singular, transcendental “I” distinguished from human, empirical, natural “I”
VP.linkedContent: in phenomenology, transcendental consciousness, the archi-region, is absolutely singular, transcendental “I” distinguished from human, empirical, natural “I”

VP.content: wouldn’t [contra Husserl] universal element of expressivity forbid fulfillment of Bedeutung when we say “I” in solitude, dispossessing the subject of full intuition of “I”?
VP.linkedContent: wouldn’t [contra Husserl] universal element of expressivity forbid fulfillment of Bedeutung when we say “I” in solitude, dispossessing the subject of full intuition of “I”?

VP.content: Husserlian distinction btwn the manifested (subjective) and the expressed as named: “I” is always an indicative monstration; “glass of water, please” names the thing and manifests the desire
VP.linkedContent: Husserlian distinction btwn the manifested (subjective) and the expressed as named: “I” is always an indicative monstration; “glass of water, please” names the thing and manifests the desire

VP.content: for Husserl, “subjective” adverbs (here, there, above, below, none, yesterday) function as subjective and occasional expressions just like word “I”; these are different from contingent expressions which have plurivocity, and objective expressions which are absolutely pure of contamination: mathematical expressions
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, “subjective” adverbs (here, there, above, below, none, yesterday) function as subjective and occasional expressions just like word “I”; these are different from contingent expressions which have plurivocity, and objective expressions which are absolutely pure of contamination: mathematical expressions

VP.content: for Husserl, the Bedeutung of “I,” for the one who speaks, is realized > immediate representation of our personality; but, isn’t every expression only possible in relation to absence of object, absence of intuition, meaning, in this example, the absence of “I”?
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, the Bedeutung of “I,” for the one who speaks, is realized > immediate representation of our personality; but, isn’t every expression only possible in relation to absence of object, absence of intuition, meaning, in this example, the absence of “I”?

VP.content: Husserl: “I” is “a universally operative indexical of the fact”
VP.linkedContent: Husserl: “I” is “a universally operative indexical of the fact”

VP.content: “my death is structurally necessary to pronouncing the ‘I,’” it is an active structure, and it must function against all falsehood, meaning “I am dead” must function as Bedeutung outside of intuition (fact of my death)
VP.linkedContent: “my death is structurally necessary to pronouncing the ‘I,’” it is an active structure, and it must function against all falsehood, meaning “I am dead” must function as Bedeutung outside of intuition (fact of my death)

PAS.content: Blanchot: instead of contradiction “I am, I am not,” rubbing (usant) against each other like stones, I write, “I think, therefore I am not”
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: instead of contradiction “I am, I am not,” rubbing (usant) against each other like stones, I write, “I think, therefore I am not”

PAS.content: the one who says “I” depends by his name, in his identity, on terrifyingly ancient event of another viens, le même pourtant > the drowned (noyé) as the one who says “I”
PAS.linkedContent: the one who says “I” depends by his name, in his identity, on terrifyingly ancient event of another viens, le même pourtant > the drowned (noyé) as the one who says “I”

F.content: Derrida reverses Freud: Wo Ich war soll es werden [Wo Es war, soll Ich werden]
F.linkedContent: Derrida reverses Freud: Wo Ich war soll es werden [Wo Es war, soll Ich werden]

DS.content: [Derrida comes back to i] reads little point as a decapitation right next to castrated pike > capital I (disseminates unity of meaning), ego, ice, écho—plus-je > (I + Dé)irisation
DS.linkedContent: [Derrida comes back to i] reads little point as a decapitation right next to castrated pike > capital I (disseminates unity of meaning), ego, ice, écho—plus-je > (I + Dé)irisation

FWT.content: “I” am not alone w/ myself, “I” am not all-one, an “I” is not an indivisible atom
FWT.linkedContent: “I” am not alone w/ myself, “I” am not all-one, an “I” is not an indivisible atom

OS.content: Heidegger, like Hegel, equates I = I w/ time, in the form “I think” is time
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger, like Hegel, equates I = I w/ time, in the form “I think” is time

ATIA.content: single embrace of Kant, Descartes, Levinas, Lacan, Heidegger, like chasing, hunting, trying to take hold of cuttlefish, touch the animal in a way where it will expel its ink (encre), its anchor, in this case, w/ these folks, the ink as the ability to do the “I,” before autoreference; (in the name of autobiography) Derrida confides the animalist “vision” he has of what he does, what he writes > his “sole concern” is to not sacrifice to it any difference, fold, opening to-come
ATIA.linkedContent: single embrace of Kant, Descartes, Levinas, Lacan, Heidegger, like chasing, hunting, trying to take hold of cuttlefish, touch the animal in a way where it will expel its ink (encre), its anchor, in this case, w/ these folks, the ink as the ability to do the “I,” before autoreference; (in the name of autobiography) Derrida confides the animalist “vision” he has of what he does, what he writes > his “sole concern” is to not sacrifice to it any difference, fold, opening to-come

ATIA.content: for Kant, the power to have the “I” is the erection of man, infinitely above: the subject
ATIA.linkedContent: for Kant, the power to have the “I” is the erection of man, infinitely above: the subject

ATIA.content: Kant’s fundamental anthropocentrism, man possesses representation “I”: tautological, egological, autographical
power of “I”: “I can I,” a divine injunction that empowers man (not simply speak I, but think I, be present as self, as I)
ATIA.linkedContent: power of “I”: “I can I,” a divine injunction that empowers man (not simply speak I, but think I, be present as self, as I)

PS.content: the “I” who hears becomes the “I” who speaks, stealing speech from the “I” who thinks he speaks and is heard in his own name: s’introduisant dans le nom de celui qui parle, cette différence n’est rien, elle est le furtif: la structure du dérobement instantané et originaire sans lequel aucune parole ne trouverait son souffle [w/out Artaud’s valuation, this sentence affirms differance]
PS.linkedContent: the “I” who hears becomes the “I” who speaks, stealing speech from the “I” who thinks he speaks and is heard in his own name: s’introduisant dans le nom de celui qui parle, cette différence n’est rien, elle est le furtif: la structure du dérobement instantané et originaire sans lequel aucune parole ne trouverait son souffle [w/out Artaud’s valuation, this sentence affirms differance]

SW.content: could a “theory of fetishism” ever measure up to infinite tenderness of “my own tallith” (as if such phrase preceded ipseity, the ability to say “I”)?
SW.linkedContent: could a “theory of fetishism” ever measure up to infinite tenderness of “my own tallith” (as if such phrase preceded ipseity, the ability to say “I”)?

PIO.content: for Austin, “I” has the privilege of the performative; parabasis (parekbasis)
PIO.linkedContent: for Austin, “I” has the privilege of the performative; parabasis (parekbasis)

PF.content: old, inexhaustible question of “I”: how can a universal substitute lodge itself in unicity resisting all substitution? > most universal in most singular of alibis w/out alibi
PF.linkedContent: old, inexhaustible question of “I”: how can a universal substitute lodge itself in unicity resisting all substitution? > most universal in most singular of alibis w/out alibi

TR.content: Rousseau: thanks to active/passive, mechanical theft, I was able, finally, to sign “I”
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau: thanks to active/passive, mechanical theft, I was able, finally, to sign “I”

TR.content: violence of “I”: irreducibly singular, yet nothing more universal, anonymous
TR.linkedContent: violence of “I”: irreducibly singular, yet nothing more universal, anonymous

TR.content: w/ reference to unjust justice [phrase Derrida admits having stolen from de Man], where the law suspends reference right as it requires it, where chacun, “each one,” is appropriated (always theft/deceit) in utterance “I” > all justice begins in perjury
TR.linkedContent: w/ reference to unjust justice [phrase Derrida admits having stolen from de Man], where the law suspends reference right as it requires it, where chacun, “each one,” is appropriated (always theft/deceit) in utterance “I” > all justice begins in perjury

TR.content: since every “I” is an “I”——tout autre est tout autre as the same: (the) I can betray w/out least appearance becoming manifest > substitution “I” for “I”: root of perjury
TR.linkedContent: since every “I” is an “I”——tout autre est tout autre as the same: (the) I can betray w/out least appearance becoming manifest > substitution “I” for “I”: root of perjury

TR.content: Rousseau’s “I was as if,” the theft of the “I”:  one cannot steal a “what” w/out stealing, even raping, a “who,” a woman, child, man
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau’s “I was as if,” the theft of the “I”: one cannot steal a “what” w/out stealing, even raping, a “who,” a woman, child, man

TR.content: deceit/theft of singular I by universal I, just injustice, ineluctable subterfuge/substitution
TR.linkedContent: deceit/theft of singular I by universal I, just injustice, ineluctable subterfuge/substitution

TR.content: what is terrifying: what cuts me off from my own initiative [?] > automaticity discuplates & threatens “me”—quasi-excuses, ghosts of excuses, quasi-faults, spectral silhouettes of pardons: “as if” of this quasi, limitless risk of becoming simulacrum, virtuality
TR.linkedContent: what is terrifying: what cuts me off from my own initiative [?] > automaticity discuplates & threatens “me”—quasi-excuses, ghosts of excuses, quasi-faults, spectral silhouettes of pardons: “as if” of this quasi, limitless risk of becoming simulacrum, virtuality

IW.content: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national
IW.linkedContent: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national

IW.content: “I” signs first in its spiritual language

PJP.content: Derrida considers anacoluthon the most productive figure, a general formalization of Miller’s “polylogology”: multiplicity of voices, more than 1 voice in 1 voice, trace of perjury gets lost, leads us astray > this dispersion threatens concept, identity, identity of “I”
PJP.linkedContent: Derrida considers anacoluthon the most productive figure, a general formalization of Miller’s “polylogology”: multiplicity of voices, more than 1 voice in 1 voice, trace of perjury gets lost, leads us astray > this dispersion threatens concept, identity, identity of “I”

D.content: “I” w/ only illusion of mastery, decided by a throw of dice: law of chance
D.linkedContent: “I” w/ only illusion of mastery, decided by a throw of dice: law of chance

D.content: “I” that attends its own incessant, violent reinscription, a pure passageway for operations of substitution, a mere function or ghost
D.linkedContent: “I” that attends its own incessant, violent reinscription, a pure passageway for operations of substitution, a mere function or ghost

D.content: “I”: passing passageway for permutation, repercussive percussion, full force of writing > d’un coup, triggers (déclenche) tale & keeps (maintient) it in progress
D.linkedContent: “I”: passing passageway for permutation, repercussive percussion, full force of writing > d’un coup, triggers (déclenche) tale & keeps (maintient) it in progress

D.content: simulacrum [of “I”] as a force, le simulacre de l’assistance: chambre obscure: feigns to transform the imperfect into present: impossible > et vous entraîne dans un nouveau vertige
D.linkedContent: simulacrum [of “I”] as a force, le simulacre de l’assistance: chambre obscure: feigns to transform the imperfect into present: impossible > et vous entraîne dans un nouveau vertige

D.content: “I” as surface vacant of itself: foments (prepares a poison) cruel dispossession > reaches simulacrum point: où il peut à la fois teindre le tissu (stains the tissue) et feindre to tell you truth about it
D.linkedContent: “I” as surface vacant of itself: foments (prepares a poison) cruel dispossession > reaches simulacrum point: où il peut à la fois teindre le tissu (stains the tissue) et feindre to tell you truth about it

HST.content: for Levinas, resurrection/survival becomes miracle of each instant, where an “I” calls out for forgiveness (salvation, redemption, Messiah), every instant
HST.linkedContent: for Levinas, resurrection/survival becomes miracle of each instant, where an “I” calls out for forgiveness (salvation, redemption, Messiah), every instant

HST.content: Levinas: future (avenir) as a resurrection of the present; “next instant” is an annulment of commitment to existence made in the instant; the “I’s” death in the empty interval: condition of new birth
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: future (avenir) as a resurrection of the present; “next instant” is an annulment of commitment to existence made in the instant; the “I’s” death in the empty interval: condition of new birth

HST.content: Levinas: response to the hope for the present is the very expression of the“I,” exigency to redeem instant of despair; hope for present as a primary fact in mystery of work of time
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: response to the hope for the present is the very expression of the“I,” exigency to redeem instant of despair; hope for present as a primary fact in mystery of work of time

HST.content: for Levinas, “I” [never identical] not a being that attempts a new instant, “I” is exigency for the non-definitive; “I”: need for time
HST.linkedContent: for Levinas, “I” [never identical] not a being that attempts a new instant, “I” is exigency for the non-definitive; “I”: need for time

HST.content: Levinas: “I” does not endow itself w/ this [temporal] alterity: impossibility of dialectical time is impossibility of saving oneself by oneself (alone)
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: “I” does not endow itself w/ this [temporal] alterity: impossibility of dialectical time is impossibility of saving oneself by oneself (alone)

+R.content: bait (amorce) for Christic phallus (Ichthys): track, graph or trace (Ichnos) of a voiceless bit (mors), Derrida translates title of Adami’s picture [on Glas] as Ich [I’m exhibiting Ich—as an other]
+R.linkedContent: bait (amorce) for Christic phallus (Ichthys): track, graph or trace (Ichnos) of a voiceless bit (mors), Derrida translates title of Adami’s picture [on Glas] as Ich [I’m exhibiting Ich—as an other]

+R.content: survival movement, arrêt de mort, final trance, sursaut cambré tenu au mors: says “I” (am dead) or hoc est corpus meum > dominant fish, one that bites best, takes from sea a body of scaly writing, homogenous w/ signatory’s initials
+R.linkedContent: survival movement, arrêt de mort, final trance, sursaut cambré tenu au mors: says “I” (am dead) or hoc est corpus meum > dominant fish, one that bites best, takes from sea a body of scaly writing, homogenous w/ signatory’s initials

+R.content: death dance in fish’s tail (queue) > rhythmos: cadence of writing, undulation of waves
+R.linkedContent: death dance in fish’s tail (queue) > rhythmos: cadence of writing, undulation of waves

C.content: le M’hors-serie (I’m-out-of-series), Fors-series, the excluded necessary that marks the border of the Necessary itself: the necessary, the excepted, the contingent, sauf, fors
C.linkedContent: le M’hors-serie (I’m-out-of-series), Fors-series, the excluded necessary that marks the border of the Necessary itself: the necessary, the excepted, the contingent, sauf, fors

C.content: I am myself cartouche and cartouches(s) in the plural: “I” sign myself to death as soon as there’s the title, reduce myself to first heading, capital, shrunken head
C.linkedContent: I am myself cartouche and cartouches(s) in the plural: “I” sign myself to death as soon as there’s the title, reduce myself to first heading, capital, shrunken head

LI.content: “I” no less iterable than any other word > whatever singularity function of “I” possesses: does not guarantee adequation btwn saying/meaning
LI.linkedContent: “I” no less iterable than any other word > whatever singularity function of “I” possesses: does not guarantee adequation btwn saying/meaning

LI.content: “I” w/ quotation marks marks tendencies, styles, types, situations rather than a person
LI.linkedContent: “I” w/ quotation marks marks tendencies, styles, types, situations rather than a person

TN.content: “I touches itself, I self touches (Je se touche)”: tactile figure of pure auto-affection
TN.linkedContent: “I touches itself, I self touches (Je se touche)”: tactile figure of pure auto-affection

TN.content: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth

TN.content: Nancy’s heart transplant, l’intrus, is not the quasi-transcendental strangeness that refers to all our “I’s,” and yet… [the 2 strangenesses keep making signs toward one another]
TN.linkedContent: Nancy’s heart transplant, l’intrus, is not the quasi-transcendental strangeness that refers to all our “I’s,” and yet… [the 2 strangenesses keep making signs toward one another]

TN.content: via de Biran, sense of “I” comes from hand: rough, too heavy resistance > he would know nothing about himself, if he did not experience resistance
TN.linkedContent: via de Biran, sense of “I” comes from hand: rough, too heavy resistance > he would know nothing about himself, if he did not experience resistance

TN.content: for Husserl, introjection is a late, upper layer of experience
TN.linkedContent: for Husserl, introjection is a late, upper layer of experience

TN.content: can there be solipsism w/out introjection? “I” requires intersubjectivity?
TN.linkedContent: can there be solipsism w/out introjection? “I” requires intersubjectivity?

TN.content: there would be auto-affection “effects,” but their analysis can’t escape hetero-affection that makes them possible, keeps haunting them
TN.linkedContent: there would be auto-affection “effects,” but their analysis can’t escape hetero-affection that makes them possible, keeps haunting them

TN.content: constitution of body proper would thus assume passage outside through “technē of bodies,” spacing, death, nonliving, other, mourning > everything the “solipsistic” tries to keep out (maintenir au-dehors)
TN.linkedContent: constitution of body proper would thus assume passage outside through “technē of bodies,” spacing, death, nonliving, other, mourning > everything the “solipsistic” tries to keep out (maintenir au-dehors)

ATM.content: Levinas’ “here I am” or “I think”: a restlessness driving me out of substantiality
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas’ “here I am” or “I think”: a restlessness driving me out of substantiality

AD.content: Levinas: “here I am (me voici),” pronoun in accusative, declined before any declension
AD.linkedContent: Levinas: “here I am (me voici),” pronoun in accusative, declined before any declension

AD.content: how could an automatic, proper “I” make an immanent “decision” w/out the tearing rupture (rupture déchirante) we associate w/ “free” decision?
AD.linkedContent: how could an automatic, proper “I” make an immanent “decision” w/out the tearing rupture (rupture déchirante) we associate w/ “free” decision?

AD.content: receiving beyond capacity of “I” > dissymmetrical disproportion marks law of hospitality
AD.linkedContent: receiving beyond capacity of “I” > dissymmetrical disproportion marks law of hospitality

AD.content: Levinas, surprisingly, calls reason this hospitable receptivity (reorients philosophical tradition, which thinks sensibility as passive opposition to reason)
AD.linkedContent: Levinas, surprisingly, calls reason this hospitable receptivity (reorients philosophical tradition, which thinks sensibility as passive opposition to reason)

AD.content: for Pascal, strip “I” of everything attributed to it, make it naked, bare; for Levinas, nudity is infinitely exposed vulnerability—skin
AD.linkedContent: for Pascal, strip “I” of everything attributed to it, make it naked, bare; for Levinas, nudity is infinitely exposed vulnerability—skin

LG.content: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] I bring forth to light (donne le jour) precisely the law as the right-to-sight (droit de voir), this law has “me” at its/her disposal? > the “I” sans “I” of narrative voice does not take place, engenders the lawmen [panoptic demand: synopsis]
LG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] I bring forth to light (donne le jour) precisely the law as the right-to-sight (droit de voir), this law has “me” at its/her disposal? > the “I” sans “I” of narrative voice does not take place, engenders the lawmen [panoptic demand: synopsis]

LG.content: law demands a testimony oriented by a sense [genre] of history, ordonné par la raison and unity of “I think (je pense)”: originally synthetic apperception accompanying all representations
LG.linkedContent: law demands a testimony oriented by a sense [genre] of history, ordonné par la raison and unity of “I think (je pense)”: originally synthetic apperception accompanying all representations

LG.content: that “I” does not always accompany itself > radically persecutes the law
LG.linkedContent: that “I” does not always accompany itself > radically persecutes the law

LG.content: l’épreuve of a récit brought to light the madness of genre—spinning (faire tourner) Peterson’s genre-disc, comme un soleil fou > dividing borders btwn literature and its others
LG.linkedContent: l’épreuve of a récit brought to light the madness of genre—spinning (faire tourner) Peterson’s genre-disc, comme un soleil fou > dividing borders btwn literature and its others

LG.content: “this is the whole of it,” only what “I” see, kneeling [à genoux] at edge of literature, “le loi en somme, ce que ‘je’ voit et que ‘je’ dit que je vois en un récit où je/nous somme”
LG.linkedContent: “this is the whole of it,” only what “I” see, kneeling [à genoux] at edge of literature, “le loi en somme, ce que ‘je’ voit et que ‘je’ dit que je vois en un récit où je/nous somme”

BSi.content: to uniquely human “I” of Descartes and Kant, Lacan adds superego (Law/Crime) > i.e. animals don’t have superego
BSi.linkedContent: to uniquely human “I” of Descartes and Kant, Lacan adds superego (Law/Crime) > i.e. animals don’t have superego

BSi.content: sovereignty of self-present ipseity, only man can say “I”—autodeictic (Kant, Heidegger, Descartes)
BSi.linkedContent: sovereignty of self-present ipseity, only man can say “I”—autodeictic (Kant, Heidegger, Descartes)

CIR.content: if you knew, G., my experience of prayers, you would know everything, my “without-interest” in the depths of me, “I” is only misdirection—presumed crime I’m calling circumcision
CIR.linkedContent: if you knew, G., my experience of prayers, you would know everything, my “without-interest” in the depths of me, “I” is only misdirection—presumed crime I’m calling circumcision

CIR.content: trying to disinterest myself from myself, destroying  “I” before death comes to meet it
CIR.linkedContent: trying to disinterest myself from myself, destroying “I” before death comes to meet it

CIR.content: “I” even w/in same sentence not the same

SPEC.content: [given Freud’s “new” genre] new distinction btwn narrator’s “I” and author’s “I”
SPEC.linkedContent: [given Freud’s “new” genre] new distinction btwn narrator’s “I” and author’s “I”
